results.title: Cubism
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and George Barford
results.brief_description: Traces the development of cubism as a style of painting through the works of the artists who experimented with it. Shows how interest in Cezanne’s painting led Picasso and Braque to experiment with pictorial arrangement and to develop both analytical and synthetic cubism.
results.description: Traces the development of cubism as a style of painting through the works of the artists who experimented with it. Shows how interest in Cezanne’s painting led Picasso and Braque to experiment with pictorial arrangement and to develop both analytical and synthetic cubism.

results.title: Cube
results.creator_credit: Trimark Pictures, Feature Film Project, Cube Libre, Mehra Meh, Betty Orr and Vincenzo Natali
results.brief_description: First time director Vincenzo Natali’s low budget thriller is a tribute to the ensemble cast performances as well as his direction. The action takes place in what appears to be an experiment in human survival as a select group of people wake up contained within the walls of a cube, twenty-six identical rooms wide and twenty-six high. How they got there is not made clear but finding their way out is the whole premise of the film. The skill-sets of this particular group of people aid or hinder their survival - for example, an old thief works out a way to find out if a room is booby-trapped or not - and survival is at stake because the cube kills and this is shown in scenes of visceral gore. The production design by Jasna Stefanovic, music by Mark Karven and some very believable special effects add to the tense but dreamlike sci-fi mood of the film. Human behaviour under stress provides the viewer with a gripping and edgy personal drama - even though ‘participants’ have been de-humanised by being used like guinea pigs in a maze. Cast includes Nicole DeBoer, Nicky Guardagni, David Hewlett, Andrew Miller, Julian Richings, Wayne Robson and Maurice Dean Wint.

results.title: Cuba and Fidel
results.creator_credit: Focal Point, Churchill Films, Christine Burrill, David Davis and Saul Landau
results.brief_description: The film focuses on an interview with Fidel Castro interwoven with aspects of Cuba. Castro speaks about differences with the United States which led to severed relations, about changes in Cuba since the revolution, about socialism and capitalism. He defends Cuba’s “coercive” society on economic grounds as a necessity during a transition period. The camera follows him on tours of inspection, particularly to a new housing project where he visits an apartment that overflows with residents. The film shows the contrasts of old and new, industrialization and poverty.

results.title: Cuba
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Arlene Sellers, Alex Winitsky and Richard Lester
results.brief_description: This very entertaining drama of adventure and romance is set in Havana in late 1959 as the corrupt regime of Cuba’s General Batista starts to crumble as Fidel Castro’s forces begin their takeover of the country. Sean Connery gives a powerful and compelling performance as a British soldier-of-fortune who hires himself out to venal Cuban general Martin Balsam to help put down the insurrection. He has no political views, but as he grows aware of the brutality and corruption of the regime and the gulf between Cuba’s rich and poor, his sympathies begin to shift…

results.title: CSIRO Sonic fineness testers. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: Part one of a two-part series. Demonstrates two methods of measuring fineness, or the diameter of the fibre, in wool: in the laboratory using Sonic Fineness Tester Model A, and in the field using portable Sonic Fineness Tester Model B.

results.title: Crystals: flowers of the mineral kingdom
results.brief_description: Discusses the shape of crystals, depicts frost farming and goes on to show simple applications of crystals. The relationship between crystal properties and uses is illustrated with aluminium.

results.brief_description: Introduces the subject of crystals by demonstrating the orderly arrangement of atoms in the crystalline state and the relation of this arrangement to the physical properties of the substances.

results.title: Crystals and their growth
results.brief_description: Crystals of quartz, granite, snow and salt are used to show the nature and growth of crystals and their importance in modern science and technology. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Crystals
results.brief_description: This film shows us the various processes by which crystals are formed, including that of salts in solution by evaporation; of rock formations by percolation of water through the earth; of the melting and cooling of minerals; and the crystallisation of substances in solutions contained in the cells of various plants. Actual crystallisation is recorded by means of time-lapse micro-cinematography.
